column4: hello,i have a problem with nvidia drivers: i can startx after : killing X server(because of the failsafe mode),rmmod nvidia insmod /lib/modules/2.6.24-16-generic/volatile/nvidia_new.ko and then startx...but how can i make the module load and remplace the stock nvidia
modprobe nvidia_new doesn't load the nvidia_new kernel module...i think i must edit the modules configuration files at /lib/modules/2.6.24-16-generic
but hoz do i do that?
s/hoz/how
I'm troubleshooting a problem with nvidia_new too
The "Hardware Drivers" window has nvidia_new checked as being enabled, but it still says "not in use"
turns out that's because the nvidia-glx-new package isn't seen as being available, because the installer apparently didn't download any package lists during installation
ah...mabe try manualy: killall Xorg log into console,rmmod nvidia,insmod /lib/modules/2.6.24-16-generic/volatile/nvidia_new.ko, startx and look at the dmesg logs
ah ok so install it...i used envyng manual installation...
Actually, all I did was "sudo apt-get update"
then re-open the hardware drivers window, and it works as expected (shows the nVidia driver not-enabled until I click on it, and then installs the driver package)
ok
You don't need to modprobe nvidia_new manually
i need to do it automaticaly but it modprobes the wrong nvidia driver
wrong driver?
yes...when it startx it goes in failsafe mode unless i insmod nvidia_new manualy
Why are you using startx, first of all?
because after killing X gdm doesn't start
but X does start initially?
no
so what should i do?
